meanings.definition: A prolonged period of abnormally low rainfall.
meanings.sent1: During the drouths, the fields turned dry and cracked.
meanings.sent2: The farmers struggled to grow crops during the drouths.
meanings.sent3: The drouths were so long, even the cacti were thirsty!
meanings.sent4: In the drouths, the land thirsted for the missing raindrops.
meanings.sent5: The drouths painted the landscape in shades of brown and yellow.

meanings.definition: A lack or shortage of something.
meanings.sent1: The drouths of kindness in the world saddened her.
meanings.sent2: There was a drouths of laughter in the silent room.
meanings.sent3: His drouths of patience made him tap his foot impatiently.
meanings.sent4: The drouths of creativity left her feeling uninspired.
meanings.sent5: The drouths of love in his heart made him feel lonely.
